poem:
Title: The Imprint of Dissolution

A behemoth foundered, that of Reckitt Benckiser,
On a sea of mercantile calamity.
Its throbbing heart, a milk-ladened ship
Drowned in the abyss of a costly sip.
Shares shivered, never to regather warmth; 
A specter that Kapoor, erstwhile helmsman,
Apprehends in the cold tide of time,
Witnessing his kingdom's disquieting chime.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Reckitt Benckiser: how one terrible deal wrecked the company The worst acquisition by a major UK company in the last decade? It’s hard to think of a deal that beats Reckitt Benckiser’s $18bn purchase in 2017 of Mead Johnson Nutrition, a US-listed maker of baby milk formula. Shares in the Dettol-to-Durex group have never recovered from the shock. By way of add-on award, Rakesh Kapoor, Reckitt’s chief executive back in the day, can probably scoop". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
